main event: On July 7, 1966, four witnesses observed six 'coffee-cup' shaped objects in Centerville, Ohio, for approximately 10 minutes.
interesting points: The objects made sharp turns and quickly vanished after 10 minutes of observation,The witnesses reported hearing an explosion during the sighting,The objects were described as bright and had no noticeable obstructions blocking the view, A potential explanation mentioned was that the objects could have been parachutes or toys, Dr. J. Allen Hynek suggested that the event might have coincided with July 4 celebrations due to the audible explosion.
witness description: A man, his wife, and two children observed the objects.
